questions.question: What should happen when a user creates a note while offline?
options: Show an error and prevent creation
Save locally and queue for sync when online
Save to a temporary cache only
questions.explanation: In offline-first architecture, the note should be saved to the local database immediately and a sync operation queued. When connectivity is restored, the sync queue processes and pushes changes to the server.

questions.question: Why do we use UUIDs instead of auto-increment IDs in offline-first apps?
options: Auto-increment requires server roundtrip to get the ID
questions.explanation: Auto-increment IDs require the server to assign the ID, which is not possible offline. UUIDs can be generated client-side without any server communication, making them ideal for offline-first apps.
